key_observations: Macro data shows strong positive liquidity signals (US_NET_LIQUIDITY, US_M2_YOY, GLOBAL_M2_USD all POSITIVE)
Credit conditions show mixed signals with both NEGATIVE (HY/IG spreads, Fed funds) and POSITIVE (yield curve) factors
Volatility factor (VIX) shows NEGATIVE direction, indicating low volatility environment
Price data shows generally positive price action across multiple assets on T-1
Regime data indicates BULL market with high confidence (0.98)
risk_factors: FED_RRP_BALANCE shows NEGATIVE direction, indicating potential liquidity withdrawal
Credit spreads (HY/IG) both show NEGATIVE direction, suggesting some credit stress
Fed funds rate NEGATIVE direction indicates restrictive monetary policy
Limited data scope - only macro factors available, no sentiment, technical, or onchain data
reasoning_summary: Analysis based solely on available macro data showing predominantly positive liquidity conditions supporting bull regime, with some credit-related risk factors. Fragility score reflects stable conditions with normal risk levels given the observed macro environment.

D_btc_specific.note: Global regime assessment, not BTC-specific in this cycle
